content.title: Surgical Grant For The Prevention Of Disability
content.details: The main objective of the scheme is to provide surgical assistance for the prevention of disability to poor and helpless disabled persons. The financial grant will be provided for various medical treatments including surgeries for visually handicapped, hearing impaired, orthopedically handicapped, and post-leprosy-cured disability.
benefits: A maximum of Rs. 6,00,000/- will be provided to each disabled person.
eligibility: The annual income of the applicant/applicant's guardian should not exceed Rs.60,000/-
The applicant should be an Indian citizen
Applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttar Pradesh or be a resident of the state for at least 5 years
Should not be guilty in any criminal case
content.application_process: 1. Download the application form from page no. 18. 2. Fill out the application form. 3. Attach the required documents. 4. Submit the application to the District Disabled Welfare Officer.
documents_required: A certificate of disability granted by a competent medical authority
Certificate of annual income (from all sources)
Estimated expenditure details of the surgery by the superintendent/in charge of the State Hospital

faqs.question: What is the scope of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Surgical Grant for the Prevention of Disability' scheme is started by the Government of Uttar Pradesh and operated by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities.

faqs.question: What are the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Each disabled person will be provided financial assistance up to Rs. 6,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All disabled persons from Uttar Pradesh state, who fulfill the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: For which medical treatment financial grant will be provided?
faqs.answer: Surgery for the visually handicapped, hearing impaired, orthopedically handicapped, and post-leprosy-cured disability.

faqs.question: Can only the people of the Uttar Pradesh state apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttar Pradesh or be a resident of the state for at least 5 years.

faqs.question: May other state couple apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, but they must be a resident of Uttar Pradesh for at least 5 years.

faqs.question: What is the financial eligibility for applicant?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the applicant/applicant's guardian should not exceed Rs.60,000/-.

faqs.question: How To Apply For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: 1. Download the application form. 2. Fill out the application in the prescribed manner. 3. Enclose the required documents. 4. Submit the application to the District Disabled Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Needed?
faqs.answer: 1. Photograph. 2. Identification Proof. 3. Income Proof. 4. A certificate of disability granted by a competent medical authority. 5. Certificate of annual income (from all sources). 6. Estimated expenditure details of the surgery by the superintendent/in charge of the State Hospital.

faqs.question: How to download the application form?
faqs.answer: Download the application form from page no. 18.
